sen.j: 1324年（元亨4）には般若寺に文殊菩薩像を造り、1326年から後醍醐中宮藤原禧子の御産祈願と称して鎌倉幕府の調伏などを行っていた事が発覚し、1331年（元徳2）には逮捕され硫黄島 (鹿児島県)へ流罪となる。
sen.e: In 1324 he made the statue of Monju Bosatsu at Hannya-ji Temple and it was brought to light that he had implemented rituals to destroy Kamakura Shogunate in nominal terms of wish for an easy delivery by FUJIWARA no Kishi, the Empress of Godaigo, since 1326, so that he was arrested in 1331 and was sentenced to deportation to Io-jima Island (Kagoshima Prefecture).

In 1324, he made the statue of Monju Bosatsu (Manjusri Bodhisattva associated with wisdom, doctrine and awareness) at Hannya-ji Temple and it was brought to light that he had implemented rituals to attempt to destroy the Kamakura Shogunate, by FUJIWARA no Kishi, chugu (the second consort of an emperor) of Godaigo from 1326, so he was arrested in 1331 and was sentenced to deportation to Io-jima Island (Kagoshima Prefecture).

sen.j: 1333年（正慶2/元弘3）に元弘の変の後に鎌倉幕府が滅亡すると京都へ戻り、建武の新政から南北朝時代となっても後醍醐方に属して吉野へ随行し、東寺長者、大僧正となる。
sen.e: When Kamakura Shogunate was subverted after Genko no hen (the Genko Incident) in 1333, he went back to Kyoto, and he also moved to Yoshino in attendance on Godaigo and became Chief abbot of To-ji Temple and Daisojo, high priest, during Nambokucho Period after Kenmu Restoration.
